record.dc:title: Albacore fishery in French Polynesia
record.dcterms:alternative: Exploitation des germons en Polynésie Française
record.dc:creator: Abbes R.
Josse E.
Paul Ichinel
record.dc:subject: Albacore Tuna
Tuna fisheries
record.dc:description: Albacore fishery in French Polynesia paper presented during the 5th South Pacific Albacore Research Workshop, Papeete 1993
record.dcterms:abstract: The deep albacore fishery in French Polynesia is involving. In addition to the asiatic long-liners which hâve been operating in the Economie Zone for several years, a polynesian fleet, currently composed of 4 twenty five meters tuna vessels will be extended to vessels within 3 years. Two of the four boats have been fishing in 1991 and 1992, and hâve catched respectively 46 and 23 tonnes of albacore. The asiatic longliners are targeting more and more other tunas of higher value (i.e. big eye tuna) than albacore which total catch decreased within the 10 past years from more than 1 000 tonnes to 534 and 230 tonnes in 1991 and 1992.
